newsitem.title: IRAN: Tehran Mayor defends arrested employees.
newsitem.headline: Tehran Mayor defends arrested employees.

text.p: The mayor of Tehran has attacked the arrest of four senior officials at his municipality for alleged financial corruption as politically motivated, a newspaper reported on Sunday.
Gholamhossein Karbaschi said the arrest last month of his security chief and other officials was "unjustified, politically motivated and unacceptable. I am ready to stand up and defend my employees."
His comments were carried by the English-language Iran News.
Iranian police seized four officials at Tehran municipality late in July, including the financial and administrative director, the security chief and the mayor of a Tehran suburb.
Iran News said 100 parliament deputies in Tehran had written to Judiciary Chief Ayatollah Mohammad Yazdi denouncing the arrests.
Newspapers said the arrests followed calls by senior clerics and supreme leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei declaring "war on financial corruption and illegally acquired fortunes".
Iranian leaders have called for tough action against corruption following a series of trials for embezzlement and fraud at state agencies and banks in recent years.
Iran News said the mayor was a supporter of new President Mohammad Khatami and has been accused by hardline conservatives defeated in May's elections of mismanagement of municipal authority.
